title: Part (a)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response neither explains one way in which monopolistic competition is similar to perfect competition (e.g., monopolistic competition is similar to perfect competition because they both have large numbers of firms and easy entry and exit) NOR explains one way in which monopolistic competition is similar to a monopoly (e.g., they both have market power, face a downward-sloping demand curve, and their price is greater than the marginal cost P>MC MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqr1ngB PrgifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9fr Fj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=x fr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadcfacq GH+aGpcaWGnbGaam4qaaaa@3E2A@ profit-maximizing quantity).

The response explains one way in which monopolistic competition is similar to perfect competition (e.g., monopolistic competition is similar to perfect competition because they both have large numbers of firms and easy entry and exit) OR explains one way in which monopolistic competition is similar to a monopoly (e.g., they both have market power, face a downward-sloping demand curve, and their price is greater than the marginal cost P>MC MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqr1ngB PrgifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9fr Fj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=x fr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadcfacq GH+aGpcaWGnbGaam4qaaaa@3E2A@ at the profit-maximizing quantity).

The response explains one way in which monopolistic competition is similar to perfect competition (e.g., monopolistic competition is similar to perfect competition because they both have large numbers of firms and easy entry and exit) AND explains one way in which monopolistic competition is similar to a monopoly (e.g., they both have market power, face a downward-sloping demand curve, and their price is greater than the marginal cost P>MC MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqr1ngB PrgifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9fr Fj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=x fr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadcfacq GH+aGpcaWGnbGaam4qaaaa@3E2A@ at the profit-maximizing quantity).

title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes three of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes all four of the criteria below..

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include either of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part (d)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must both state no and explain why in order to receive each point.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes both of the criteria below.
